The ‘Agricultural Trucking Relief Act’ would ensure that all #agriculture products are treated equally under federal transportation regulations & provide clarity for Georgia’s farmers, producers & truck drivers. I’m glad to cosponsor this bipartisan bill. #GeorgiaGrown

Hurricane Michael devastated Georgia farmers. Our Georgia congressional delegation is still working to get farmers needed aid as soon as possible. Our bipartisan bill on this long-awaited road safety measure to limit maximum speeds on large trucks is endorsed by @RoadSafeAmerica, @TruckSafteyOrg, @SafeRoadsNow, The Trucking Alliance, Parents Against Tired Truckers and more. #SpeedLimitersSaveLives
With the summer travel season underway, we can all take steps to be more cautious on the roadways. This bill to enact a pending rule would help keep more Americans safe.

Today, the Senate will begin the week with votes to confirm several more judicial nominees. Later this week, the Senate is expected to vote on Judge J.P. Boulee of Decatur, Ga., to fill a vacancy on the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Georgia in Atlanta.

Last week, the city of Sugar Hill, Ga., broke ground on a veterans memorial plaza to honor the service and sacrifice of those who served in every war from World War II to the more recent wars in the Middle East. Read more about the official ceremony here: https://www.gwinnettdailypost.com/local/sugar-hill-nods-to-veterans-with-memorial-groundbreaking-on-d/article_d144e1fc-8879-11e9-98ab-8317ce346471.html …

A special thanks to the French for their warm hospitality throughout our trip this week. The bond between the United States and France is strong, and I look forward to working together for many years to come.

It has been an incredibly moving week for me in France. I appreciate everyone who took the time to meet with our bipartisan delegation over the last several days, and I am especially grateful for the sacrifices made by our greatest generation during World War II.

Among the U.S. airborne units participating in today’s jump was the 75th Ranger Regiment and Airborne and Ranger Training Brigade based out of Ft. Benning, Ga. It was an honor to join these paratroopers and pay tribute to those who made the same jump so many years ago. pic.twitter.com/7EyUnqZugi

To conclude our trip commemorating the 75th anniversary of D-Day, our bipartisan Senate delegation attended a ceremony today in Sainte-Mère-Église, where U.S. and foreign airborne units recreated the jumps made by American and Allied paratroopers more than 75 years ago. pic.twitter.com/Qj4jcqMsh5

Today, June 4, 2019, is the 100th anniversary of the passage of the 19th amendment by the U.S. Senate. Glad that the Senate passed S.Res.212 celebrating the 100th anniversary of women’s suffrage. I cosponsored this legislation in honor of #womensvote100. pic.twitter.com/vmZ3nFQVmc

After an unfortunate delay, I'm pleased to see the U.S. House pass disaster aid legislation. Our Georgia farmers & millions of Americans are hurting, and I hope it will quickly be signed into law.
